channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Impossible
channel.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Boss
channel.desc: Susan Calman hosts the quiz show where being in control is everything. Who will emerge as the Boss and walk away with the cash? Only the strongest players will survive the game.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Tournament
channel.desc: Eight contestants compete in a series of fast-paced quiz battles in an attempt to eliminate their opponents from the day's game and walk away with a cash prize.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Menu
channel.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from London and the south east must go head-to-head and cook their six-course menus again. They need to impress judges Tom Kerridge, Nisha Katona and Ed Gamble. Today's guest judge is Illustrator of the Year at the British Book Awards Dapo Adeola.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Big Little Journeys
channel.desc: In the forests of western Madagascar, a tiny chameleon emerges from the nest. It is the beginning of one of the strangest of all journeys. Her urge is to climb and reach the high branches where she can hide amongst the leaves.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin is joined by experts Will Axon and Mark Stacey. Will meets his match when he comes across a World War I bayonet, while Mark is given a run for his money when it comes to knowledge about Royal Doulton.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Eddie Kadi, Natasha Raskin Sharp, Charlie Stayt and Faye Tozer take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rick Stein's Food Stories
channel.desc: Rick continues his food tour of London in Walthamstow, meeting head brewer Jaega Wise, who explains why craft beer is so fashionable. Along the way, Rick discovers more about Walthamstow's little-known silent film studios.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Hairy Bikers Go West
channel.desc: For their next adventure in the west of Britain, the Bikers are exploring Merseyside, a place that holds a lot of childhood memories for them both. It's also an area of the world renowned for its unbeatable musical heritage and cultural identity.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: With Storm Eunice - and its 100 mph winds - battering the south coast, the Portsmouth crew have to decide whether they can even launch to a wind surfer in trouble. It's reported that the casualty doesn't have his diabetes medication with him.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Gone
channel.desc: A convicted criminal linked to the case escapes from prison as Diana and Richter track down their latest suspect.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Natural World
channel.desc: At the jungle animal hospital in Guatemala, the wards are full of exotic patients, many of them orphans rescued from the illegal pet trade.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live at the Apollo
channel.desc: Emmanuel Sonubi welcomes Troy Hawke and Olga Koch to the stage.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Human
channel.desc: Around 12,000 years ago, as the Ice Age finally thaws, humanity makes a dramatic shift - abandoning nomadic life for permanent settlements.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Fake or Fortune?
channel.desc: Fiona Bruce and Philip Mould investigate a mysterious unsigned landscape that was snapped up at auction for just ?35. Could it be a lost work by Frances Hodgkins, the trailblazing New Zealand-born artist?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saving Lives at Sea
channel.desc: Every day around the UK, an army of unpaid volunteers put their lives on the line to try and save lives. The story of ordinary men and women who are giving up their free time to staff more than two hundred RNLI lifeboat stations.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
channel.desc: Amol Rajan sits down with Kemi Badenoch to discover more about the woman seeking to become Britain's next prime minister. Born in the UK but raised in Nigeria, Badenoch reveals her unexpected route to becoming leader of the Conservatives.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Chess Masters: The Endgame
channel.desc: The four remaining players from the first heat return to the Great Hall to battle it out for a coveted place in the semi-finals. They are faced with a memory test set by world number one chess player Magnus Carlsen.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Animal Park
channel.desc: As the keepers head home for the evening, the cameras keep rolling. So, what really goes on after dark?

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Money for Nothing
channel.desc: Rub-a-dub-dub, is there cash in the tub? In Wales, a pair of dated tub chairs really push new maker Ali out of her comfort zone.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Anna Haugh's Big Irish Food Tour
channel.desc: Wildlife broadcaster Liz Bonnin has travelled the world but keeps coming back to County Clare. Anna finds out about preserving heritage crops and they meet a goat cheesemaker.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Portillo ventures into the bowels of an immense hydroelectric dam to learn how the Swiss use their mountainous environment to power the country. He winds his way by rail through the Swiss Alps in search of the origins of Switzerland's political confederation. Crossing Lake Lucerne, he discovers the meadow where, according to legend, Switzerland was founded in the 13th century.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News
channel.desc: A comprehensive compilation of the latest and the most important news stories, updates and developments from the UK and different parts of the world.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Best Bakes Ever
channel.desc: Actress and cake expert Jane Asher brings together a selection of recipes from the nation's favourite television chefs. Baking fans get another chance to experience classic dishes from the likes of the James Martin, Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, the Hairy Bikers, Raymond Blanc, Nigella Lawson, Tom Kerridge, Lorraine Pascale and Rachel Khoo.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC News Special
channel.desc: Two-minute silence for VJ Day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bargain Hunt
channel.desc: Charlie Ross and the teams shop for antiques in Anglesey with help from experts Roo Irvine and Richard Madley.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Impossible
channel.desc: Contestants compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Boss
channel.desc: Susan Calman hosts the quiz show where being in control is everything. Who will emerge as the Boss and walk away with the cash? Only the strongest players will survive the game.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Tournament
channel.desc: Eight contestants compete in a series of fast-paced quiz battles in an attempt to eliminate their opponents from the day's game and walk away with a cash prize.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Great British Menu
channel.desc: The heats for Northern Ireland begin. Returning to the programme for a third time is Gemma Austin, chef patron of A Peculiar Tea. Joining her are John Hollywood from County Armagh, Kerry Roper, head chef at Stix and Stones in Belfast, and Matt Jordan, who heads up the kitchen at Shu in Belfast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Natural World
channel.desc: Looking at the secret lives of the wildlife in one of Britain's favourite gardens. Featuring a family of foxes play after hours, toads in the Italian garden and badgers that clear up the tea rooms at night. Set against the background of the gardening year, these stories reveal life behind the scenes at Heligan.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Paul Martin presents from Powderham Castle in Devon. Dating back to the 14th century, it is the long-standing home of the Courtenay family. Antiques experts Claire Rawle and Mark Stacey find great treasures among hundreds of visitors to the stately home. Claire meets a steam train fan with a great collection of memorabilia.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
channel.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Eddie Kadi, Natasha Raskin Sharp, Charlie Stayt and Faye Tozer take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Rick Stein's Food Stories
channel.desc: In Kent, Rick harvests English cherries at a family-run farm. From Ramsgate, he heads out to sea in search of Dover sole, his favourite fish, and in Margate, he celebrates the artist Joseph Turner and Britain's love of fish and chips.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: SOS: Extreme Rescues
channel.desc: A 15-year-old mountain biker has serious injuries after a downhill crash, a climber is frozen with fear on Eryri's most dangerous ridge, and two French visitors come unstuck.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: Ruth and Brian are thinning the biennials they sowed earlier in the summer, and there is a visit to a garden that was designed for the Chelsea Flower Show but is now taking root in Cumbernauld.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: Monty is cutting back in the Cottage Garden to make room for annuals, harvesting tomatoes and taking sage cuttings in the Herb Garden. Joe Swift visits a historic allotment site in Nottingham which has been brought back to life.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Gone
channel.desc: With Mt Affinity locked down with lead suspect Frank Pastor on the loose, Diana and Richter must solve the case before the Mountain Murder gets to their next victim.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Wild
channel.desc: A seasonal tale of how the Garden of Eden really was invaded not by a bad snake, but by one of the nation's favourite little birds.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Mammoth
channel.desc: PE teacher Tony Mammoth is back from the dead with his old job back. He's determined he'll approach it the same way as in the 70s, including parents' evening. Along the way, he finds out he has a lot more in common with a pupil's mum than he thought.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsnight
channel.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the day's top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: BBC Weather
channel.desc: The latest weather forecast.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Colette
channel.desc: After moving to Paris, author Sidonie-Gabrielle Colette agrees to ghostwrite a semi-autobiographical novel for her husband. Its success soon inspires her to fight for creative ownership and overcome the societal constraints of the early 20th century.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Panorama
channel.desc: Lucy Letby was found guilty of unimaginable crimes. But some experts say there was no evidence to support her conviction. Judith Moritz investigates.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Moment of Proof
channel.desc: A man is found dead in his flat, and he's been robbed. But when toxicology tests reveal the victim died after drinking a deadly cocktail, police are under pressure to find the evidence to prove their prime suspect is a killer.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: What Happened at Hiroshima
channel.desc: As the world marks 80 years since the US dropped atomic bombs on the Japanese cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki, Jordan Dunbar hears from the only people who have ever experienced and survived a nuclear explosion.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Human
channel.desc: Shocking new insights into the demise of modern humans' sister species, the Neanderthals, Homo sapiens's possible role in their downfall and how it become the last human species on Earth.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Hey Duggee
channel.desc: Duggee is cleaning the clubhouse so the Squirrels take refuge in the treehouse, but it's getting a little bit cramped. Norrie has an idea, they need to add an extension.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Mojo Swoptops
channel.desc: Mojo and Bo were supposed to paint fresh lines on the street. But when they get into a race with Tao, the paint goes in every direction, causing wild traffic chaos.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
channel.desc: Grizzy watches the Lemmings play hide-and-seek and cannot refrain from sabotaging their game by revealing their hiding places. The Lemmings challenge him to play against them, and the two sides then try to outdo each other in cunning and trickery.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
channel.desc: The Lemmings have organised a mega party at the cabin. This is obviously not to Grizzy's liking and the bear throws them out. The Lemmings discover a cave where the party is even more fun, but their ruckus drives out the bats.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Pok?mon Horizons: The Series
channel.desc: Arboliva of the Six Heroes emerges onto the `Wing Deck' battlefield of the Brave Olivine. Galarian Moltres and Lapras also appear. Liko and Roy decide to test their strength against Arboliva and Galarian Moltres, while Dot takes on Lapras.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Bro's in Control
channel.desc: Callum levels up a challenge with a massive inflatable assault course in the back garden. Callum will decide who is the bounciest bro and who is just full of hot air.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Next Step
channel.desc: No longer dance captain, Anthony finds following orders difficult.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Next Step
channel.desc: Keeping the Brawl a secret pains Ariana. Micheldon reminisce, and Anthony avoids Adele.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Newsround
channel.desc: News magazine keeping young viewers up to date with the latest stories and events happening at home and abroad.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Super Happy Magic Forest
channel.desc: While on a quest to keep her hero safe on her long journey, superfan Blossom fusses and frets too much, making things awkward.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Gardeners' World
channel.desc: Monty is cutting back in the Cottage Garden to make room for annuals, harvesting tomatoes and taking sage cuttings in the Herb Garden. Joe Swift visits a historic allotment site in Nottingham which has been brought back to life.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Long, Hot Summer
channel.desc: A drifter's arrival in a small Mississippi town has an unsettling effect on the members of a wealthy family, who decide that he is a potential suitor for their daughter.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Best Bakes Ever
channel.desc: With Britain more obsessed with baking than ever, actress and cake expert Jane Asher brings together a selection of recipes from the nation's favourite television chefs, for `Best Bakes Ever'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Richard III
channel.desc: Richard, the Duke of Gloucester, frames his brother, George, in the murder of King Edward in a devious attempt to take over the throne of England.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: WA Diamond League Athletics
channel.desc: After a month-long break, Diamond League athletics returns in Poland as a packed stadium is expected in Silesia. Faith Kipyegon is back on the track, fresh from her attempt to become the first woman in history to run a four-minute mile. At this meet in 2024, Mondo Duplantis and Jakob Ingebrigtsen both broke world records and they return in the men's pole vault and the men's 1500m respectively, with Olympic 100m champion Julien Alfred the best of the sprinters in action.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Antiques experts Catherine Southon and Jonathan Pratt find a selection of antiques and collectibles to take to auction. Jonathan uncovers a dinosaur egg that could date back 80 million years, while Catherine Southon falls in love with a Chinese silk kimono. Paul Martin visits the gardens of Caerhays, which showcase the work of intrepid plant hunter George Forest.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: The Hundred
channel.desc: Defending champions Oval Invincibles host the Welsh Fire at the Oval in a match that sees Australian Steve Smith return to a ground where he has hit three Test centuries. In 2024, Australian leg-spinner Adam Zampa was player of the match with figures of 3-24. This year, Oval have replaced him with Afghan legend Rashid Khan, having switched from the Trent Rockets. Alex Hartley and Rick Edwards present, alongside Phil Tufnell, Steven Finn and Carlos Brathwaite.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Roy Orbison at the BBC
channel.desc: A deep-dive into the BBC's archives to celebrate the great Roy Orbison, full-time rock `n' roll legend, part-time Traveling Wilbury and the man Elvis famously described as `the best singer in the world'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Roy Orbison and Friends: A Black and White Night
channel.desc: The iconic musician Roy Orbison performs a set of his greatest hits, such as `Pretty Woman' and `Crying', backed by an eclectic ensemble of stars including Tom Waits and Bruce Springsteen.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Roy Sings Orbison
channel.desc: Roy Orbison sings some of his greatest hits, including `Only the Lonely', `Crying', `Penny Arcade', `Blue Bayou', `Running Scared', `Candy Man', `In Dreams', `Mean Woman Blues', `It's Over' and `Oh, Pretty Woman'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Roy Orbison: One of the Lonely Ones
channel.desc: Biography of iconic rock balladeer Roy Orbison told through his own voice, casting new light on the triumphs and tragedies that beset his career. Using previously unseen performances, home movies and interviews with many who have never spoken before, the film reveals Orbison's remote Texas childhood, his battles to get his voice heard, and how he created lasting hits like Only the Lonely and Crying.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: I Saw the Light
channel.desc: Singer and songwriter Hank Williams rises to fame in the 1940s, but alcohol abuse and infidelity start to take their toll on his career and marriage to fellow musician Audrey Mae Williams.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Parenthood
channel.desc: Parenting in the ocean demands dedication and intelligence. From navigating the reef, to teaching young to hunt giants, these parents have remarkable strategies.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: This Is BBC TWO
channel.desc: A preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The A to Z of TV Gardening
channel.desc: Carol Kirkwood explores subjects that all begin with the letter W.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: OFF Air
channel.desc: This channel is off air, or it has temporarily no EPG data yet. We are working on a fix.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: OFF Air
channel.desc: This channel is off air, or it has temporarily no EPG data yet. We are working on a fix.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Breakfast
channel.desc: The BBC's Breakfast programme features the latest news, sport, business, weather and other items on a daily basis.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Beechgrove Garden
channel.desc: Ruth and Brian are thinning the biennials they sowed earlier in the summer, and there is a visit to a garden that was designed for the Chelsea Flower Show but is now taking root in Cumbernauld.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Weatherman Walking
channel.desc: This walk is one for nature lovers. Derek Brockway's on Anglesey with its majestic cliffs constantly pounded by roaring waves. Along his walk from Porth Swtan to Cemly Bay, he visits a long house restored by locals and tries his hand at whittling. He also discovers tales of the treacherous waters and helps monitor a colony of terns on a reserve set up by an aviation hero.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
channel.desc: A feast of food from Bryn Williams, Judy Joo, Georgina Hayden and Paul Ainsworth. Meanwhile, Rick Stein and the Hairy Bikers head out and about across the UK.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: On the Waterfront
channel.desc: An ex-boxer who works on the New York docks inadvertently becomes involved in a murder, and must take on the gangsters who rule the Longshoremen's Union. Music by Leonard Bernstein.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
channel.desc: It's Reduce, Reuse, Recycle week, with sewers creating a zero-waste jacket, transforming discarded tents and raiding wardrobes to Make Do and Mend for new outfits.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Live: Super League Rugby
channel.desc: Coverage from the Super League as St Helens take on Huddersfield.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Fake or Fortune?
channel.desc: An American couple think their $200 portrait could be a long-lost work by artist Angelica Kauffman. The evidence is promising, but its condition raises alarming questions.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Flog It!
channel.desc: Elizabeth Talbot and Philip Serrell discover a rare and intriguing picture by a troubled artist, and Paul visits the home of the British oyster industry and gets hands on with a conservation project that hopes to save this world-famous delicacy.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Italian Job
channel.desc: A group of petty criminals plan to rig a major traffic jam to divert attention from their bank heist.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Top Gear
channel.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are in Italy to take part in a series of tricky challenges and increasingly loud arguments as they attempt to find the world's best hot hatchback. Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Hammond championing the Fiat 500C Abarth and May making the case for the Renaultsport Clio Cup. Petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is the `Star in the Reasonably Priced Car'.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Murder Case
channel.desc: While embarking on a solo charity cycle ride from Fort William in the Scottish Highlands to his home in Tillicoultry, 63-year-old former navy officer Tony Parsons vanishes without a trace. This astonishing case unravels in ways no one could predict.

channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: The Silence of the Lambs
channel.desc: Multi-Oscar-winning thriller about a trainee female FBI agent who is seconded to the hunt for a horrific serial killer. For insight into the workings of his diseased mind she turns to the psychotic yet urbane Dr Hannibal `the Cannibal' Lecter, with whom she forms a compelling and dangerous relationship.
